Title: From the Editor's desk…: April 2016
Abstract: © 2016 European Association for the Study of the LiverImplementation of four simple interventions can reduce premature alcohol related deaths Data from many, many sources have confirmed that there is a direct relationship between the amount of alcohol consumed and the risk of death at the individual and at a national level. The article by Sheron, provides an excellent evidence-based insight into the existing data and proposes 4 relatively simple solutions to tackle the problem. [Figure presented] • Regular incremental above inflation tax increases• Minimum price for alcohol,• Effective protection of children from alcohol marketing and• Low-level interventions from clinicians.Implementation of these proposed solutions requires concerted action from all involved.
